#summary This page describes how to set anonymous access on the site

= What is Anonymous access? =

Anonymous Access gives users access to a web site without prompting them for a user name or password.

= Why is this required on our site? =

Anonymous Access is required on Small Business Site, so that the end users can browse through the company profile and strategies without logging onto the site. This is generally the case with company websites showcasing the company details.

= Enable anonymous access on the site =

Enabling anonymous access on a !SharePoint site has 2 steps:

  # Turn on Anonymous access on Web Application  
    * The process begins in Central Administration.
    * Click on Manage Web Applications and select your web application from the list and take a look at the ribbon:<br>http://free-sharepoint-small-business-website-template-theme.googlecode.com/svn/wiki/Images/ribbon_anonymous.jpg
    * Click Authentication Providers<br>http://free-sharepoint-small-business-website-template-theme.googlecode.com/svn/wiki/Images/ribbon_anonymous2.jpg
    * From this menu you select an Authentication Provider<br>http://free-sharepoint-small-business-website-template-theme.googlecode.com/svn/wiki/Images/ribbon_anonymous3.jpg
    * From the next menu you can check Enable anonymous access<br>http://free-sharepoint-small-business-website-template-theme.googlecode.com/svn/wiki/Images/ribbon_anonymous4.jpg
  # After you click save, the web application will allow Anonymous access to be set, but you have to set this from the actual web site. So now, navigate to the top level site collection for the web application and click Site Actions > Site Settings > Site Permissions. From that menu you can click Anonymous Access:<br>http://free-sharepoint-small-business-website-template-theme.googlecode.com/svn/wiki/Images/ribbon_anonymous5.jpg
    * From there select Entire Web Site and click OK.
http://free-sharepoint-small-business-website-template-theme.googlecode.com/svn/wiki/Images/ribbon_anonymous6.jpg
  # Turn on the read access of the list (used by the Servics webpart)
    * Click Start -> All programs -> Microsoft SharePoint 2010 Products -> SharePoint 2010 Management Shell
	http://free-sharepoint-small-business-website-template-theme.googlecode.com/svn/wiki/Images/PowerShellStart.jpg
    * Write the following script on the shell
      * $webapp = Get-SPWebApplication "http://SERVER_URL"
      * $webapp.ClientCallableSettings.AnonymousRestrictedTypes.Remove([microsoft.sharepoint.splist], "GetItems")
      * $webapp.Update()

Thatâ€™s all you have to do, now the site will be available for browsing by anyone.
